author: {'steamid': '76561197995335467', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1441943959}
review: Better late than never, this game's super fun! It feels like couch multiplayer is dead now, but I loved playing this back in the day. There's a surprising amount of depth to your move set and there's a lot of techniques you can hone and get better at the longer you play. Try a few sessions consistently with the same people and your games will become insanely close and frantic. Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2465, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1661500391}
review:
It's basically Nidhogg but in space with a gun.

There's a good single-player component with 30 missions to play, it's nice, I enjoyed it. 

The game just doesn't have a lot of content and you'll get tired of it after an hour or so. But it's nice! It was a nice hour!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082117469', 'num_games_owned': 12527, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1639516624}
review:
Jeu qui reprend les codes des jeux d'arcades de versus d'arène des années 90 à la sauce actuelle.
Composé d'un mode solo pour apprendre le système du jeu, mais reste simple à faire pour quelqu'un sachant y faire dans ce genre de jeu.
La direction artistique globale du jeu est complètement basé sur les jeux de borne d'arcade des années 90.
Pour des défis plus lourd n'hésitez à débloquer le mode Missions Rush en Solo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106252095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1635710253}
review:
This game is worth 5 bucks.  What you get when you buy this game is beautiful animations, fantastic music, and fast-paced gameplay that's easy to pick up while having a lot of depth for those willing to master it.  The solo missions do a great job of easing you into the game's mechanics while not bogging you down in tutorials.  And the multiplayer experience is frankly amazing.

Your full enjoyment of the game will depend on if you can set it up with multiplayer though.  It basically requires 4 remotes; playing with keyboard controls puts you at a huge disadvantage.  Fortunately, the game not very resource-intensive, so you carry around a cheap laptop to play it anywhere.  Unfortunately, multiplayer is less convenient for desktop PC users, especially if your PC is set up in a bedroom or somewhere with limited space.

I had a lot of fun with this game over the years.  I can easily recommend it to anyone who can set up local multiplayer easily.  But that isn't an option for you, you may want to pass.

[/list]

[h1]단점(Negative)[/h1]
[list]
   [*]열받는 타임어택(Upset Time Attack)
   [*]온라인 멀티플레이가 되지 않음(No online multiplay, only local)
   [*]멀티플레이가 키보드 1개로는 불가능, 별도의 controller가 필요*PS Controller 미지원(Multiplay is not possible with 1 keyboard, requires the other controller *PS Controller not supported)
[/list]

[h1]Comment[/h1]
[list]
   [*]점프 후에 shield, dash, attack등의 행동을 하면 직후에 추가 점프를 반복할 수 있음(Additional jumps can be repeated immediately after every actions such as attack, shield, dash)
   [*]도전과제를 하려면 versus mode를 해야 하는데, PS controller는 안됨.
      설치된 경로에서 Settings폴더(Steam\steamapps\common\Capsule Force\UserData\Settings)에 가면, player1controls.xml, player2controls.xml 등이 있는데 이걸 이용해서 해야함
       1. ingame에서 player 1을 키보드로 변경한다음 게임을 종료한다.
       2. 상단의 파일의 player1controls.xml을 player2controls.xml로 복사한다.
       3. 게임 실행 후 versus 진행하면 된다.
      (if you want to play versus mode, you have to follow the method below *PS controllers not supported
       1. check the setup location - Steam\steamapps\common\Capsule Force\UserData\Settings
       2. The option in game, player 1 controll to the keyboard, then end the game.
       3. Copy player1controls.xml of the upper file to player2controls.xml.
       4. running the game, you can proceed versus.)
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067482644', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1469819510}
review: If you have a good friend that is willing to duel you on the couch to video games, you'll get some fun out of this. It doesn't last for too long due to the way that it's designed, but that doesn't mean the experience isn't worth having.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972297308', 'num_games_owned': 4497, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1527703981}
review:
Short but fun 2D platformer.

As one of the four available characters (they seemed pretty much the same other than their looks) you jump, shoot, dash and shield your way through a bunch of short missions.

There are three different mission types:
- Target practice = Hit all the targets scattered around the stage using either your gun, shield or dash.
- Danger Zone = Reach the goal while avoiding enemies/traps.
- Dash = Rush to the goal as fast as possible.

There are multiple stages, each with their own gimmick, and despite each stage being only 20-60 seconds long most of them were fun to play through.

This is the type of platformer where you are supposed to try and get a good ranking, so if replaying the same stage 10, 20, 30 times in a row while trying to reach the goal just 0.01 seconds faster is not something that sounds fun to you, you should probably skip this game.

Personally, I had a blast. It took me 3.5 hours to get an S rank on all the missions, and in my opinion Capsule Force is definitely worth a purchase. Even at full price, if you don't want to wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1504413709}
review: Theres basicaly no point to owning this. Its a local multiplayer only game that can only use controllers, so if you you have 4 controllers to plug in on your pc monitor thats the only possible scenario. IT DOESNT EVEN HAVE BOTS, what game in 2017 doesn't have bots or online multiplayer. There are a few single player things that involve shooting targets in a set period of time, which is as interesting as it sounds. There are other boring ones but you can't even play those till youve completed all the other ones. 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087236236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1514080856}
review: The game is very fun, but it only has local multiplayer that you need controlers for and the controls don't work very well on pc.  The game does have a few missions to try out, 2 groups of shooting targets, 1 static and 1 moving, 2 groups of races to an objective, 1 on platformers and the other while fired upon. These are fun, but don't make the game worth it if you can't do local multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033995360', 'num_games_owned': 2161, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1487025662}
review:
Il fut un temps où le summum du chic était de se mouler la graisse dans un maillot de bain une pièce. Projetant nos fantasmes sur une certaine idée du futur, on imaginait que les voitures volantes et les combinaisons moulantes étaient les seules alternatives crédibles à l’apocalypse pour l’après-bogue de l’an 2000. Capsule Force s’inspire de cet imaginaire fait de latex et de couleurs criardes pour nous emmener dans le futur tel qu’on se le représentait dans le passé. S’il dispose d’un mode solo qui n’est en fait qu’une compilation de challenges dont on fait vite le tour si l’on ne court pas après le score, Capsule Force est avant tout un jeu de multijoueur local. On peut s’y affronter jusqu’à quatre ; deux équipes se disputent la progression d’une capsule qu’on essaie de faire avancer jusqu’à la base ennemie pour marquer un point, un peu à la manière d’un Team Fortress. Autour de la capsule, une pluie de tirs lasers, qu'ils soient ceux des joueurs ou des tourelles qui leur pourrissent la vie.

Avec son gameplay précis et dynamique, Capsule Force promet de beaux combats faits de vengeances, d’acharnements sur le plus faible et de retournements de situation pour punir les relâchements de fin de partie. Un bon jeu d’appoint pour finir des soirées entre amis pendant que le perdant déprime en nous entendant nous amuser, lui qui regrette déjà d’avoir proposé de décider qui ferait la vaisselle à PES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1473124407}
review:
Schwierig. Im Singleplayer ist das Game in meinen Augen nicht unbedingt der Knaller. Die Grafik sorgt für mittelschwere Krämpfe in der Netzhaut, der Sound erzeugt eine Mischung aus Humor und Aggression und die Story ist so wirr, das kann nur aus ner harten Sake-Nacht entstanden sein. Aber. Und das aber ist der Punkt, das Game bietet einen Lokalen Multiplayer Spielmodus, der sich anders spielt als der Singleplayer. Und dieses gemeinsam vor der Kiste zocken in dem Modus, scheint Spass zu machen, wenn ich die Meinungen der anderen Gamer richtig verstehe. Kann ich leider nicht beurteilen. Hab keine Freunde. Also mein Rat: Wer Freunde hat und ziemlich abgestumpfte Sehnerven sowie gerne Sake trinkt - das Game könnte Euch interessieren.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zCLeutxAPxU

author: {'steamid': '76561198026637457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1471049549}
review:
[u]SinglePlayer-only Review[/u] (Local Multiplayer only, no online)
It plays like a fast scrolling-shooter.
You get 32 missions, half of them are like "Target Smash" from Smash Bros, where you try to destroy all the targets fast, and the other half are loosely platformers where you die in one hit but wanna finish real fast.
There's also 1 secret boss fight, don't know why the only boss fight was a secret.

If you're the type of person that likes trying to S-rank short challenges, you might enjoy this.
The artstyle is nice.

Controller recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1470834539}
review:
Well meh :/ This is pc game no console game, not many people play with friends on the couch in pc games, who have couch in front of pc anyway :D No online multiplayer, no bots, no single player campaign expect target practice missions etc.
If you play on keyboard and other person on pad, pad have way more better control on targeting and player using keyboard will probably lose every time, mouse support would help but no, there is none :/
Also detecting if you want to use keyboard and other player pad or something also doesn't work, you need to go to options and to it manually, not big deal but other games can do that on the flay without any trouble.
About game itself it can be fun for a moment if you have equal chances - more pad no keyboard for one player. Graphic is ok but nothing special and there is a very little content, in 15-20min you will see most of it, there are some unlocks, new layouts, skins and concept but unfortunately doesn't add much to the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1467867778}
review:
[h1]A Local Multiplayer Platforming Shooter[/h1]
https://youtu.be/bEsP6CfWgss
+ Missions add nice short platforming levels which mainly consist of getting to the end of the stage within a certian time while avoiding obstacles or hitting targets. Doing these unlocks a few new skins and concept art.

- No bots / Online Multiplayer, meaning you can not even start the main game mode of this game without having multiple controllers / friends to play with. (Honeslty need to stop supporting devs who make "local-only" games)
- I felt like overall the game was lacking content. I mean personally I feel like this game could have been so much better as an actual side-scrolling action shooter with enemies,

author: {'steamid': '76561198066310712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1457281693}
review:
I recently purchased this game after having it recommended to me multiple times through steam and hearing about it via the 'Hello, From the Magic Tavern' podcast. I'm a fan of the indie platformers and willing to try most things under $20 if they are justified. I honestly hoped to find more to this local multiplayer game but after under an hour on single player mode I'm having a difficult time.

The missions are similar to early smash brothers target practice modes, 'avoid getting hit' speed runs, general control testing and advanced versions of target practice. Beating modes with ranks C or above means moving onto the next set of missions (eventually resulting in alternate stage layouts), B and above means alternate costumes, A and S rank means concept art. Beating all mission types and levels unlocks hardmode and credits.

If this game goes under 60% on sales and you host video game parties comfortably with steam then pick this game up for variety, otherwise I can't reccomend this for single players who require online multi-player more often than not.
The art style is very cute and I greatly support the people at the previously mentioned podcast.

1 Anime/5 Animes

author: {'steamid': '76561198057339005', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1457235843}
review:
プレイヤーはショット/チャージビーム/シールド/地面ショットハイジャンプ/ダッシュ(緊急回避的)が行えて、
攻撃・防御行動時にはさらに1回ジャンプできるので、面白いぐらいというか無限にぴょんぴょん飛べます。
動きも速くすいすい動くので、爽快感が結構大きかったです。

1人用モードのミッションは「ターゲットを全て破壊する」「障害を突破してゴールに辿り着く」モードがあって、
クリア評価Sを全て取るのは一部ステージが異様に難しかったですが、達成感はありました。
クリア評価問わずミッションを全てクリアだけなら、1～2時間で終わっちゃうかも。
高評価クリアすると地味ですがコンセプトアート等の特典が開放されるようになっています。
75%OFFで買いましたが、個人的にはその分は楽しめたと思います。

2016/02/18現在、対戦モードはオンライン/対CPUが無いようなので、
オンラインでわいわいプレイしたい人とかには向いていません。
1人用ミッションをオールSクリアしてやるという人であれば、セールなら買い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044376007', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1451175595}
review:
La verda es que lo compré un poco a ciegas porque solo había visto un par de videos, pero desde el primer momento me impresionó como juego multijugador.

Lo mejor que tiene es la posibilidad de jugar con 3 amigos mas y su modo de juego adictivo y muy entretenido, sin olvidas su faceta competitiva.

En general yo lo calificaría como un juego muy completo ya sea para un jugador o con su modo de 4 jugadores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067937537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1440799278}
review:
While Capsule Force does has some single player missions, for the most part the game is a multiplayer experience. If you are looking at Capsule Force as a single player game you will probably be disappointed. While I had fun with the single player missions I see them more as a training exercise for the multiplayer mode. 

The multiplayer mode is where the game excels. It is hard to explain why but the game is just fun to play. The game is fast paced with both teams fighting in order to progress one of the trams towards the other team's base. Bullets will end up flying all over the screen. The game has a lot of back and forth as one team will make some progress and then the other team will regain that ground.

Unfortunately at the time of this review the game doesn't appear to have online multiplayer. This is disappointing since the game would have been better since you could then have more matches with four players which are probably more fun than two player matches.

If you like fast paced multiplayer games and the concept of the game looks interesting to you, I think you will enjoy Capsule Force.

Note: I received a free review copy of Capsule Force. Other than receiving the free review copy I received no other compensation for this review.

[url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/capsule-force-indie-game-review/] Read My Full Review [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021829666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1440719760}
review:
Capsule Force is an indie competitive local multiplayer action game by Klobit with retro graphics.  It has an appealing art style and the controls feel very fluid and responsive. 
 
It has both single and multiplayer modes to keep you entertained and is a lot of fun during heated local multiplayer skirmishes.  

I just wish that it had online multiplayer so that I could play with a wider variety of people.

I recommend this game for people who enjoy frantic local multiplayer matches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983905916', 'num_games_owned': 2196, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1440059287}
review:
t is the far future, the year is 1999, and everything looks like a 1980s space anime; no, you're not tripping on mushrooms and having a flashback to your childhood, you're playing Capsule Force.  

Capsule Force is the hot new couch competitive multiplayer game that is going to look great in your library next to Samurai Gunn, TowerFall, Nidhogg, and Hidden in Plain Sight.
